intro: Cyanthillium montanum, commonly known as the mountain bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its flowers bloom in early spring. Cyanthillium montanum is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological role in alpine ecosystems.
